resources.string: Prediction Of Divorce.
Never
Hardly
Rarely
Often
Always
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020If one of us apologizes when our discussion deteriorates, the discussion ends.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know we can ignore our differences, even if things get hard sometimes.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020We can discuss our relationship from the beginning and correct our mistakes.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020The time I spent with my husband/wife is special for us.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020We don\'t have time at home as partners.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020We are like two strangers who share the same environment at home rather than family.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I enjoy my holidays with my husband/wife.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I enjoy traveling with my husband/wife.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I think that one day in the future when I look back, I see that my spouse and I have been in harmony with each other.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My spouse and I have similar values in terms of personal freedom
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My spouse and I have a similar sense of entertainment.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Our dreams with my spouse are similar and harmonious.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020We\'re compatible with my spouse about what love should be.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020We share the same views about being happy in our life with my spouse.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My spouse and I have similar ideas about how marriage should be.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My spouse and I have similar ideas about how roles should be in marriage.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My spouse and I trust each other.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know exactly what my husband/wife likes.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know how my spouse wants to be taken care of when she/he is sick.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know my spouse\'s favorite food.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I can tell you what kind of stress my spouse is facing in her/his life.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I have knowledge of my spouse\'s inner world.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know my spouse\'s basic anxieties.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know what my spouse\'s current sources of stress are.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know my spouse\'s hopes and wishes.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know my spouse very well.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I know my spouse\'s friends and their social relationships.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I feel aggressive when I argue with my spouse.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020When discussing with my spouse, I usually use expressions such as \‘you always\’ or \‘you never\’.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I can use negative statements about my spouse\'s personality during our discussions.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I can use offensive expressions during our discussions.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I can insult my spouse during our discussions.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I can be humiliating when we discuss.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020My discussion with my spouse is not calm.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I hate my spouse\'s way of opening a subject of discussion.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020When I talk to my spouse about something, my calm suddenly breaks.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020When I argue with my spouse, ı only go out and I don\'t say a word.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I mostly stay silent to calm the situation a little bit.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Sometimes I think it\'s good for me to leave home for a while.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I\'d rather stay silent than discuss it with my spouse.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020When I discuss with my spouse, I stay silent because I am afraid of not being able to control my anger.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I feel right in our discussions.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I have nothing to do with what I\'ve been accused of.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I\'m not actually the one who\'s guilty about what I\'m accused of.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I\'m not the one who\'s wrong about problems at home.
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020I\'m not afraid to tell my spouse about her/his incompetence.
Your Result is...
You will be divorce.
You will not be divorce.
Back to HOME MENU

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Looking for that perfect song to play for your next romantic evening? Maybe you have a special date coming up, or an anniversary, or want to choose just the right music for Valentine\'s Day? Here is a list of some of the best love songs to help you create a great playlist for your special date.
"Yellow" - Coldplay
"Lover" - Taylor Swift
"No One" - Alicia Keys
"Ocean" - Lady Antebellum
"Wife You Up" - Russ
"The Bones" - Maren Morris
"Love Song" - Lana Del Rey
"You and I Both" - Jason Mraz
"When I Look At You" - Miley Cyrus
"She Will Be Loved" - Maroon 5
"Kiss Me" - Ed Sheeran
"All of Me" - John Legend
"At Last" - Etta James
"Just the Way You Are" - Bruno Mars
"Perfect" - Ed Sheeran ft. Beyoncé
"Halo" - Beyoncé
"Thinking Out Loud" - Ed Sheeran
"Love on the Brain" - Rihanna

Look at the stars
Look how they shine for you
And everything you do
Yeah they were all yellow..."
My heart\'s been borrowed and yours has been blue\nAll\'s well that ends well to end up with you...

You and me together
Through the days and nights
I don't worry 'cause
Everything's gonna be alright...

Here you are, next to me
So much beauty at my feet
All I wanna do is swim
But the waves keep crashin' in...

I'm turning down the rest for you
If they call us foul I'm fighting all the refs for you
You make me a better me
I make you a better you....

Call it dumb luck, but baby, you and I
Can't even mess it up, although we both try
No, it don't always go the way we planned it
But the wolves came and went and we're still standing...

Oh, be my once in a lifetime
Lyin' on your chest in my party dress
I'm a fuckin' mess, but I
Oh, thanks for the high life...

And it's okay if you have to go away
Oh just remember the telephones, well they work in both ways
But if I never ever hear them ring
If nothing else I'll think the bells inside
Have finally found you someone else and that's okay
'Cause I'll remember everything you sang...

When I look at you, I see forgiveness
I see the truth
You love me for who I am
Like the stars hold the moon
Right there where they belong
And I know I'm not alone...

I don't mind spendin' everyday
Out on your corner in the pourin' rain
Look for the girl with the broken smile
Ask her if she wants to stay awhile
And she will be loved, and she will be loved...

And your heart's against my chest
Your lips pressed in my neck
I'm falling for your eyes, but they don't know me yet
And with a feeling I'll forget, I'm in love now...

Cause all of me
Loves all of you
Love your curves and all your edges
All your perfect imperfections...
At last my love has come along\nMy lonely days are over\nAnd life is like a song...
Oh, you know, you know, you know I\'d never ask you to change\nIf perfect\'s what you\'re searching for, then just stay the same...

I'm dancing in the dark
With you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass
While listening to our favorite song...

Hit me like a ray of sun
Burning through my darkest night
You're the only one that I want
Think I'm addicted to your light...
But baby now\nTake me into your loving arms\nKiss me under the light of a thousand stars.

Must be love on the brain
That's got me feeling this way
It beats me black and blue but it fucks me so good
And I can't get enough...
Predict Divorce
Let\'s Predict
Love Song
Great Love Songs for Your Romantic Playlist
10 Things to Do Immediately When You Find Out Your Partner Is Cheating
This is some information for you how to do when you found that he/she is cheating on you.
8 Steps That Can Save Your Marriage from Divorce
The ways you to treat yourself for saving your marriage.
Titanic (1997)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Titanic has all the makings of a boilerplate love story: Jack (Leonardo DiCaprio) is from the wrong side of the tracks, Rose (Kate Winslet) comes from high society, and they meet by chance and fall in love. But set against the spectacle of the sinking of the historic ship — and with greatest-love-song-of-all-time contender "My Heart Will Go On" in the background — like Jack, this movie moves beyond its seemingly plain origins.
Before Sunrise (1995)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Director Richard Linklater pulls of a remarkable feat with this casual film: the entire relationship unfolds as the two main characters walk around a European city, just chatting. It proves that great romances don\'t have to be so emotionally wrought. The film spawned two sequels, Before Sunset and Before Midnight, which follow the same couple.
Portrait of a Lady on Fire (2019)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020This film-festival favorite, which was nominated for a slew of awards at the end of 2019, follows a woman who is commissioned to travel to a remote island to paint a portrait of a woman as part of an arranged marriage; of course, she falls in love with her subject, and a forbidden romance ensues.
A Star Is Born (2018)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020If you\'re looking for a story about people brought together by talent and torn apart by fame, you can watch a number of takes on A Star Is Born: There\'s the 1937 original with Janet Gaynor and Fredric March, the 1954 version with Judy Garland and James Mason, and the 1976 remake with Barbra Streisand and Kris Kristofferson. But only the most recent one, with Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper, has a performance of the heart-rending song "Shallow."
If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020"From Barry Jenkins — director of Moonlight, which is its own sort of romance — comes this James Baldwin adaptation. It's about a couple, madly in love and expecting a child, whose relationship is upended when one of them is accused of a crime he didn't commit.
Shape of Water (2017)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020If you know anything about Guillermo del Toro, then you know better than to ever try to predict what the fantastical director’s take on a love story would be. Besides, of course, that it will be more beautiful and unique than you could ever imagine. Shape of Water tells the tale of Elisa, a mute woman who works as a cleaning lady at a government laboratory, as she finds herself falling in love with the lab’s top-secret specimen: an amphibious creature. This film is a true testament that love comes in all shapes and sizes.
The Big Sick (2017)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon’s real-life hospital romance turned movie is one of the most original and thoughtful romances in years. In the face of tragedy, an estranged couple grows closer somehow by one of them being in a coma. Also, Holly Hunter is the best mom.
Silver Linings Playbook (2012)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020The first real entry of the Cooper/Lawrence film trio, Silver Linings Playbook is the story of what happens when perfectly flawed people find love together. The film also won Lawrence her first Oscar, and that’s pretty outstanding for a picture loosely categorized as a romantic comedy.
The Notebook (2004)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020Read me this story, and I’ll find you. Damn. Nicholas Sparks is cheesy and oftentimes over the top, but The Notebook is a romantic story of love that just beautiful enough that it transcends all of the cheesiness it takes to tell it.
Call Me By Your Name (2017)

\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020That peach scene is something else. The Luca Guadagnino-directed film perfectly encapsulates the feelings of first love and love lost in a beautiful Italian setting. Bonus points: CMBYN is the rare gay love story where someone doesn’t get beaten or end up with HIV.
